verses.verse: Hear<WH8085>, O Israel<WH3478>: You are to pass over<WH5674> Jordan<WH3383> this day<WH3117>, to go in<WH935> to possess<WH3423> nations<WH1471> greater<WH1419> and mightier<WH6099> than yourself<WH5892>, cities great<WH1419> and fenced up<WH1219> to heaven<WH8064>,

A people<WH5971> great<WH1419> and tall<WH7311>, the sons<WH1121> of the Anakims<WH6062>, whom you know<WH3045>, and of whom you have heard<WH8085> say<WH3320>, Who can stand before<WH6440> the sons<WH1121> of Anak<WH6061>!

Understand<WH3045> therefore this day<WH3117>, that the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> is he which goes over<WH5674> before<WH6440> you<WH398>; as a consuming fire<WH784> he shall destroy<WH8045> them<WH3665>, and he shall bring them down before your face<WH6440>: so shall you drive them out<WH3423>, and destroy<WH6> them quickly<WH4118>, as the Lord<WH3068> has said unto you<WH1696>.

Speak<WH559> not you in your heart<WH3824>, after that the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> has cast them out<WH1920> from before<WH6440> you<WH559>, saying, For my righteousness<WH6666> the Lord<WH3068> has brought me in<WH935> to possess<WH3423> this land<WH776>: but for the wickedness<WH7564> of these nations<WH1471> the Lord<WH3068> does drive them out<WH3423> from before you<WH6440>.

Not for your righteousness<WH6666>, or for the uprightness<WH3476> of your heart<WH3824>, do you go<WH935> to possess<WH3423> their land<WH776>: but for the wickedness<WH7564> of these nations<WH1471> the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> does drive them out<WH3423> from before<WH6440> you<WH6965>, and that he may perform the word<WH1697> which the Lord<WH3068> swore<WH7650> unto your fathers<WH1>, Abraham<WH85>, Isaac<WH3327>, and Jacob<WH3290>.

Understand<WH3045> therefore<WH3068>, that the Lord your God<WH430> gives<WH5414> you not this good<WH2896> land<WH776> to possess<WH3423> it for your righteousness<WH6666>; for you are a stiffnecked<WH6203> people<WH5971>.

Remember<WH2142>, and forget<WH7911> not<WH3068>, how you provokedst the Lord your God<WH430> to wrath<WH7107> in the wilderness<WH4057>: from<WH4480> the day<WH3117> that you did depart out<WH3318> of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, until you came<WH935> unto this place<WH4725>, you have been rebellious<WH4784> against<WH5973> the Lord<WH3068>.
Also in Horeb<WH2722> you provoked<WH7107> the Lord<WH3068> to wrath<WH7107>, so that the Lord<WH3068> was angry<WH599> with you to have destroyed you<WH8045>.

When I was gone up<WH5927> into the mountain<WH2022> to receive<WH3947> the tablets<WH3871> of stone<WH68>, even the tablets<WH3871> of the covenant<WH1285> which the Lord<WH3068> made<WH3772> with you<WH3427>, then I lived in the mountain<WH2022> forty<WH705> days<WH3117> and forty<WH705> nights<WH3915>, I neither did eat<WH398> bread<WH3899> nor drink<WH8354> water<WH4325>:

And the Lord<WH3068> delivered<WH5414> unto me two<WH8147> tablets<WH3871> of stone<WH68> written<WH3789> with the finger<WH676> of God<WH430>; and on them was written according to all the words<WH1697>, which the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> with you in the mountain<WH2022> out of the middle<WH8432> of the fire<WH784> in the day<WH3117> of the assembly<WH6951>.

And it came to pass at the end<WH7093> of forty<WH705> days<WH3117> and forty<WH705> nights<WH3915>, that the Lord<WH3068> gave<WH5414> me the two<WH8147> tablets<WH3871> of stone<WH68>, even the tablets<WH3871> of the covenant<WH1285>.

And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> unto me<WH6965>, Arise, get you down<WH3381> quickly<WH4118> from here<WH5971>; for your people which you have brought forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714> have corrupted<WH7843> themselves<WH4118>; they are quickly turned aside<WH5493> out of the way<WH1870> which I commanded<WH6680> them<WH6213>; they have made them a molten image<WH4541>.
Furthermore the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH559> unto me<WH559>, saying, I have seen<WH7200> this people<WH5971>, and<WH6203>, behold, it is a stiffnecked people<WH5971>:

Let me alone<WH7503>, that I may destroy<WH8045> them<WH4229>, and blot out their name<WH8034> from under heaven<WH8064>: and I will make<WH6213> of<WH854> you a nation<WH1471> mightier<WH6099> and greater than they<WH7227>.

So I turned<WH6437> and came down<WH3381> from the mountain<WH2022>, and the mountain<WH2022> burned<WH1197> with fire<WH784>: and the two<WH8147> tablets<WH3871> of the covenant<WH1285> were in my two<WH8147> hands<WH3027>.

And I looked<WH7200>, and<WH2398>, behold, you had sinned against the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430>, and had made<WH6213> you a molten<WH4541> calf<WH5695>: you had turned aside<WH5493> quickly<WH4118> out of the way<WH1870> which the Lord<WH3068> had commanded you<WH6680>.
And I took<WH8610> the two<WH8147> tablets<WH3871>, and cast<WH7993> them out of<WH5921> my two<WH8147> hands<WH3027>, and broke<WH7665> them before your eyes<WH5869>.

And I fell down<WH5307> before<WH6440> the Lord<WH3068>, as at the first<WH7223>, forty<WH705> days<WH3117> and forty<WH705> nights<WH3915>: I did neither eat<WH398> bread<WH3899>, nor drink<WH8354> water<WH4325>, because of all your sins<WH2403> which you sinned<WH2398>, in doing<WH6213> wickedly<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the Lord<WH3068>, to provoke him to anger<WH3707>.

For I was afraid<WH3025> of<WH6440> the anger<WH639> and hot displeasure<WH2534>, with which the Lord<WH3068> was angry<WH7107> against you to destroy<WH8045> you<WH3068>. But the Lord listened<WH8085> unto me at that time also<WH6471>.
And the Lord<WH3068> was very<WH3966> angry<WH599> with Aaron<WH175> to have destroyed<WH8045> him<WH6419>: and I prayed for Aaron<WH175> also the same time<WH6256>.

And I took<WH3947> your sin<WH2403>, the calf<WH5695> which you had made<WH6213>, and burnt<WH8313> it with fire<WH784>, and stamped<WH3807> it<WH2912>, and ground it very small<WH3190>, even until it was as small<WH1854> as dust<WH6083>: and I cast<WH7993> the dust<WH6083> there into the brook<WH5158> that descended out<WH3381> of the mountain<WH2022>.
And at Taberah<WH8404>, and at Massah<WH4532>, and at Kibroth<WH6914>–hattaavah, you provoked the Lord<WH3068> to wrath<WH7107>.

Likewise when the Lord<WH3068> sent<WH7971> you from Kadesh<WH6947>–barnea, saying<WH559>, Go up<WH5927> and possess<WH3423> the land<WH776> which I have given<WH5414> you<WH4784>; then you rebelled against the commandment<WH6310> of the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430>, and you believed<WH539> him not<WH8085>, nor listened to his voice<WH6963>.
You have been rebellious<WH4784> against the Lord<WH3068> from the day<WH3117> that I knew you<WH3045>.

Thus I fell down<WH5307> before<WH6440> the Lord<WH3068> forty<WH705> days<WH3117> and forty<WH705> nights<WH3915>, as I fell down<WH5307> at the first<WH3068>; because the Lord had said<WH559> he would destroy you<WH8045>.

I prayed<WH6419> therefore unto the Lord<WH3068>, and said<WH559>, O Lord<WH136> God<WH3069>, destroy<WH7843> not your people<WH5971> and your inheritance<WH5159>, which you have redeemed<WH6299> through your greatness<WH1433>, which you have brought forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714> with a mighty<WH2389> hand<WH3027>.

Remember<WH2142> your servants<WH5650>, Abraham<WH85>, Isaac<WH3327>, and Jacob<WH3290>; look<WH6437> not unto the stubbornness<WH7190> of this people<WH5971>, nor to their wickedness<WH7562>, nor to their sin<WH2403>:

Lest the land<WH776> from where you brought us out<WH3318> say<WH559>, Because the Lord<WH3068> was not able<WH3201> to bring<WH935> them into the land<WH776> which he promised<WH1696> them<WH8135>, and because he hated them<WH3318>, he has brought them out to kill<WH4191> them in the wilderness<WH4057>.
Yet they are your people<WH5971> and your inheritance<WH5159>, which you brought out<WH3318> by your mighty<WH1419> power<WH3581> and by your stretched out<WH5186> arm<WH2220>.
